str2: Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
